azureLogAnalytics.query:
AppDependencies
| summarize avgDuration=avg(DurationMs) by AppRoleName
| project AppRoleName, avgDuration

AppDependencies
| where AppRoleName==$device
| summarize avgDuration=avg(DurationMs) by AppRoleName, TimeGenerated
| project AppRoleName, avgDuration, TimeGenerated
| order by TimeGenerated asc

panels.description: Total time outs recorded in this namespace

azureLogAnalytics.query:
ContainerLogV2
| where _ResourceId contains "${cluster}"
| where PodNamespace==("$LogPodNameSpace") and LogMessage contains "Timed Out"
| extend Image=tostring(KubernetesMetadata["image"])
| summarize Timeouts=count() by Image

panels.title: All Timeouts in $cluster - $LogPodNameSpace namespace

azureLogAnalytics.query:
ContainerLogV2
| where _ResourceId contains "${cluster}" and PodNamespace==("$LogPodNameSpace") and LogMessage contains "Timed Out"
| summarize Timeouts=count() by ContainerName

panels.title: Container timeouts $cluster - $LogPodNameSpace (${__from:date:YYYY-MM-DD} - ${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD})

panels.description: Timeouts observed in each namespace. Seperated by k8s Image reporting the error.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
ContainerLogV2
| where PodNamespace==("$LogPodNameSpace") and LogMessage contains "Timed Out"
| extend Image=tostring(KubernetesMetadata["image"])
| summarize Timeouts=count() by Image
| order by Timeouts desc

panels.title: Image timeouts in $LogPodNameSpace (${__from:date:YYYY-MM-DD} - ${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD})

panels.description: Image time outs over the last 7 day span.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
ContainerLogV2
| where _ResourceId contains "${cluster}"
| where PodNamespace==("$LogPodNameSpace") and LogMessage contains "Timed Out" and TimeGenerated > ago(7d)
| extend Image=tostring(KubernetesMetadata["image"])
| summarize Timeouts=count() by bin(TimeGenerated, 7d), Image

panels.title: Image timeouts from the last 7days in $LogPodNameSpace namespace

panels.description: Timeouts observed in each namespace. Seperated by k8s Pods reporting the error.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
ContainerLogV2
| where _ResourceId contains "${cluster}"
| where PodNamespace==("$LogPodNameSpace") and LogMessage contains "Timed Out"
| summarize Timeouts=count() by PodName
| order by Timeouts desc

panels.title: Pod timeouts in $LogPodNameSpace (${__from:date:YYYY-MM-DD} - ${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD})

azureLogAnalytics.query:
AppDependencies
| where ResultCode == 2 and Success == false and TimeGenerated > ago(7d)
| extend ServiceName=tostring(Properties["service.name"])
| summarize count() by bin(TimeGenerated,1d), ServiceName
| order by TimeGenerated asc

panels.title: Service Failures in the last 7 days

panels.description: Image timeouts across cluster in within the provided window, all values from the above tables should be represented here.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
ContainerLogV2
| where _ResourceId contains "${cluster}" and LogMessage contains "Timed Out"
| extend Image=tostring(KubernetesMetadata["image"])
| summarize Timeouts=count() by Image, ContainerName
| order by Timeouts desc

panels.title: Timeout totals per image in $cluster (${__from:date:YYYY-MM-DD} - ${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD})

panels.description: Timeouts by Container for the past 24hrs.

azureLogAnalytics.query:
ContainerLogV2
| where _ResourceId contains "${cluster}" and LogMessage contains "Timed Out" and TimeGenerated > ago(24h)
| summarize Timeouts=count() by ContainerName

panels.title: Container Timeouts in $cluster (24h)

panels.description:
Broker latency across all its actions. 
Connection, Publish, Subscribe, Unsubscribe
panels.title: $cluster MQTT Broker average latency

panels.description:
Average Broker latency across all its actions over time:
Connection, Publish, Message Delivery, Subscribe, Unsubscribe
panels.title: $cluster MQTT Broker action latency overtime

azureLogAnalytics.query:
//change this example to create your own time series query
<table name>                                                              //the table to query (e.g. Usage, Heartbeat, Perf)
| where $__timeFilter(TimeGenerated)                                      //this is a macro used to show the full chart’s time range, choose the datetime column here
| summarize count() by <group by column>, bin(TimeGenerated, $__interval) //change “group by column” to a column in your table, such as “Computer”. The $__interval macro is used to auto-select the time grain. Can also use 1h, 5m etc.
| order by TimeGenerated asc

//change this example to create your own time series query
<table name>                                                              //the table to query (e.g. Usage, Heartbeat, Perf)
| where $__timeFilter(TimeGenerated)                                      //this is a macro used to show the full chart’s time range, choose the datetime column here
| summarize count() by <group by column>, bin(TimeGenerated, $__interval) //change “group by column” to a column in your table, such as “Computer”. The $__interval macro is used to auto-select the time grain. Can also use 1h, 5m etc.
| order by TimeGenerated asc

//change this example to create your own time series query
<table name>                                                              //the table to query (e.g. Usage, Heartbeat, Perf)
| where $__timeFilter(TimeGenerated)                                      //this is a macro used to show the full chart’s time range, choose the datetime column here
| summarize count() by <group by column>, bin(TimeGenerated, $__interval) //change “group by column” to a column in your table, such as “Computer”. The $__interval macro is used to auto-select the time grain. Can also use 1h, 5m etc.
| order by TimeGenerated asc

//change this example to create your own time series query
<table name>                                                              //the table to query (e.g. Usage, Heartbeat, Perf)
| where $__timeFilter(TimeGenerated)                                      //this is a macro used to show the full chart’s time range, choose the datetime column here
| summarize count() by <group by column>, bin(TimeGenerated, $__interval) //change “group by column” to a column in your table, such as “Computer”. The $__interval macro is used to auto-select the time grain. Can also use 1h, 5m etc.
| order by TimeGenerated asc
